problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following are assumptions made while analyzing a general system under the classical domain of thermodynamics?[select one or more]<<
[x] Relativistic effects are neglected. [ ] The system is perfectly insulated from the surroundings. [x] No scaling effects (size of system does not matter). [x] Properties of systems are continuous rather than quantized. [ ] The volume and shape of the system are constant [ ] Any process undergone by the system is quasi-static.
[explanation] A, C, and D are all assumptions in the classical domain of thermodynamics. We never assume that a general system is perfectly insulated, since we consider heat to be a form of energy transfer. Volume is a state property of the system; it may change during a process. It is not always necessary that a process be quasi-static. [explanation]
